intro: Lorentzia saltenia var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf lorentzia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable candidate for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and showy blooms.
